topic.title: Domain Admin Activities with the Dashboard

section.title: Domain Admin
section.p: As a Domain Admin, you can create, modify or remove projects and users from your domain. Creating new projects in the default admin domain is not recommended or supported.

section.title: Domain Admin Activities
section.p: To perform Domain Admin Activities, you must be logged into your domain.
Login to your Domain from the Dashboard login page. In the example below, TESTDOMAIN and USER1 are used to login to the dashboard.

ol.li: Enter the domain
Enter the domain admin user
Enter the password of the above user
Click Connect

sectiondiv.p: You can view your domains as a Domain Admin.

ol.li: Select Identity and Domains in the sidebar

sectiondiv.p: You can view all of your Projects in your Domain.

ol.li: Select Identity and Projects in the sidebar

sectiondiv.p: You can create a Project as Domain Admin

ol.li: Select Identity and Projects in the sidebar
Click Create Project above the projects list/table
Note Domain ID and Domain Name immutably set to the new domain
Enter a project name and description
Note the Enabled checkbox is checked by default
If necessary while creating the new project, you can click on the Project Members tab to add domain users to the project as well as adjust their roles.
Click Create Project button

sectiondiv.p: You can edit a Project as a Domain Admin

ol.li: Select Identity and Projects in the sidebar
Click the Edit Project action in the project actions dropdown
Name, Description and the Enabled checkbox attributes can be updated.
If necessary while updating the project, you can click on the Project Members tab to add users to or remove users from the project as well as adjust their roles.
Click Save once changes are complete.

sectiondiv.p: You can create a User as a Domain Admin

ol.li: Select Identity and Users in the sidebar
Click Create User above the users list/table
Note Domain ID and Domain Name immutably set to the new domain
Enter a user name, description, email address, password
Select the primary project for the user
Note the role _member_ is preselected
Note the Enabled checkbox is checked by default
Click Create User button

sectiondiv.p: You can edit a User as a Domain Admin

ol.li: Select Identity and Users in the sidebar
Click the Edit action for the user in the Users table
Update the user name, description, email address and/or primary project as necessary
Click Update User button

sectiondiv.p: You can add Users/Members to a Project

ol.li: Select Identity and Projects in the sidebar
Click Manage Members in the actions column for the project
In the left column, click the plus (+) beside the user that should be added to the project.
Click the Save button

sectiondiv.p: You can remove Users/Members from a Project

ol.li: Select Identity and Projects in the sidebar
Click Manage Members in the actions column for the project
In the right column, click the minus (-) beside the user that should be removed from the project.
Click the Save button

section.title: Domain Admins can be Project Members

sectiondiv.p: Domain Admins can be Project Members for projects in their domains.

ol.li: Select Identity and Projects in the sidebar
Click Manage Members in the actions column for the project
Ensure the Domain Admin exists in the right column as a project member and has the _member_ role selected. In this example, USER1 is the Domain Admin.
Click the Save button
